def.dt: :a young person the birth of a child She's pregnant with their first child. a play for both children and adults I went there once as a child. [=when I was a child] often used before another noun. a child prodigy a child actor child development child psychologists
:a son or daughter All of their children are grown now. an elderly couple and their adult children
:an adult who acts like a child :a childlike or childish person I'm a child when it comes to doing taxes. [=I need to be told or shown what to do] Men are such children sometimes.
:a person who has been strongly influenced by a certain place or time or by the events happening during that time She's a child of her time. a child of the Depression

dro.dre: children should be seen and not heard

dt.un: used to say that children should be quiet and well-behaved

def.dt: :pregnant She found herself with child. [=she discovered that she was pregnant]
:money that the government pays to families with children
:the process of taking care of and raising children Her husband is actively involved in child-rearing. often used before another noun child-rearing practices/methods
:money that a former husband or wife must pay regularly to help raise a child called also (Brit) maintenance
:something that is very easy to do Landing a job should be child's play for someone with his skills.
:a young person in the 1960s and 1970s who rejected the traditional values of society :hippie
:a young child who is alone at home after school because the child's parents are working called also latchkey kid
:a child whose father and mother are not married to each other when the child is born :an illegitimate child the love child of a famous actor and one of his fans
:a person who never had a brother or sister I was an only child. As an only child, it was her duty to take care of her aging parents.
:a child who has a particular disease and is shown in posters to raise money to help fight that disease

:a person who represents or is identified with something (such as a cause or product) She was a stirring speaker and activist and soon became the poster child of the antiwar movement. (humorous) My brother is the poster child for laziness. [=he is very lazy]
